intro: Anil gracilis, commonly known as slender anil, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Anil gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
